name: Beryl
slogan: Working to get more people in cities on bikes
description:
We’re a passionate team of designers, engineers, researchers and cyclists creating products that tackle the bumps in the way of urban mobility. We talk to our community and experts in order to solve real problems with simple, intelligent products, using innovative technology. Because we believe that getting more people cycling will improve the cities of the future — by making roads safer, more efficient and our world healthier.

Blaze (now beryl) was founded in 2012 by Emily Brooke with the vision of becoming world leaders in urban cycling technology. Our first product, the Laserlight, was created to tackle the biggest problem for city cyclists: being caught in the blind spot. beryl has been shipping the Laserlight to more than 65 countries worldwide since late 2013.

jobs.title: Commercial Director
jobs.description:
Location: Beryl, The Green House, 244-254 Cambridge Heath Road, London, E2 9DA

Ref: BerylCD01

SMIDSY Ltd T/A Beryl. Company registered in England, registration number: 07831245R.

OUR COMPANY: 

Here at Beryl we have a clear vision... to build a better world by getting more people in cities on bikes. Our aim is to be the UK's leading micro-mobility company, delivering financially sustainable shared schemes to UK communities. We care about safety, the environment, and beautiful design.

Headed up by Emily Brooke, the British inventor and entrepreneur known for developing the Beryl (formerly Blaze) Laserlights used for Santander Cycles, our Head Office space is based in Bethnal Green, and is the creative hub of the Brand. It is here that critical product design decisions are made, supported by a best in class Tech Dev Department.

Teams which support the infrastructure of the business also play a key role in our success,  from Operations, Finance and People, to Business Development, Sales and Marketing. Our network of bike workshops are strategically positioned to support our local markets, all underpinned by a dedicated customer service team...

Beryl is growing...fast...and now is the most exciting time to join our team.

THE ROLE:

Key activities/outcomes

Reporting to the CEO, establishing medium and longer term goals and capabilities that allow us to grow our UK and International presence.
Direct all major competitive tenders, working with teams across the organisation. 

Build a data led approach to the assessment of our competitive advantages, across our product and services and propose strategies that deliver in year goals and align the business to our long term strategy

Lead our negotiations with large partner organisations and customers as we leverage the power of our mobility platform to improve the offerings of established industry players.

Develop a thorough understanding of the mobility industry and help refine our commercial offering to the evolving market.
Supporting and leading teams

Lead the Business Development and Consumer Marketing team to focus relationships and acquisition on high value contracts and customers, owning and leading our bidding strategy.

Drive efforts to further embed commercial strategies into the decision making and implementation for team leaders within the business, fostering a culture of entrepreneurialism.

Work with Operations Director and Data Science team to deliver data led analysis of our performance

Assist the Finance team in developing and monitoring budgets, and agree appropriate reporting metrics to the business.

Development

Work with the product and technology team to help align development priorities and resources to the long term strategy of the business, delivering insights from customers and competitors.

Help business development and product teams scope proof of concept opportunities into outcome based pilot’s that will clearly lead to growth.

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE 

Sales and business development experience, having held a leading role in growing the revenue of a business through winning competitive tenders.

A strategic thinker, grounded in objective analysis but with a flare of entrepreneurial confidence to develop, test, build and execute company wide initiatives.

Ideally some experience within the mobility industry and/or public sector contracting.

Somebody who is happy to informally coach more junior members of the team in improving overall commerciality of the business, as well as standing alongside the CEO in developing and implementing long term company strategy.

You will know better than anybody how we are performing against our goals, and thrive on developing strategies and that allow us to grow revenue.

Somebody who believes in the power of bike share and electric mobility solutions to improve the lives of those in urban centres.

You embody proactivity, with a can-do roll-your-sleeves-up attitude, and don’t wait around to be told what to do!

By applying for this role, you are agreeing to our candidate privacy policy which can be found on Beryl.cc

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.description:
OUR COMPANY: 

Here at Beryl we have a clear vision... to build a better world by getting more people in cities on bikes. Our aim is to be the UK's leading micro-mobility company, delivering financially sustainable shared schemes to UK communities. We care about safety, the environment, and beautiful design.

Headed up by Emily Brooke, the British inventor and entrepreneur known for developing the Beryl (formerly Blaze) Laserlights used for Santander Cycles, our Head Office space is based in Bethnal Green, and is the creative hub of the Brand. It is here that critical product design decisions are made, supported by a best in class Tech Dev Department.

Teams which support the infrastructure of the business also play a key role in our success,  from Operations, Finance and People, to Business Development, Sales and Marketing. Our network of bike workshops are strategically positioned to support our local markets, all underpinned by a dedicated customer service team...

Beryl is growing...fast...and now is the most exciting time to join our team.

Responsibilities:

Brainstorming system architectures with the rest of the dev team
Working with design and UX teams
Designing and implementing Python-based microservice architecture components
Designing and implementing React-based server and web user interfaces
Writing unit and integration tests
Investigating and debugging issues raised in any environment
Building and improving DevOps processes
Contributing to weekly sprint planning
Contributing to open source projects

Required skills and experience:

At least 3 years experience building web applications and back-end development in python
Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL)
Strong understanding of modern JavaScript (ES6), HTML and CSS
Experience working with React. A candidate who has overcome the challenges of these two technologies past their basic usage, such as utilising React’s context API, asynchronous actions, and higher order components.
Has developed containerised applications using Docker
DevOps experience AWS/Google Cloud 
Experience building REST APIs
Takes pride in readable, well-designed, well-tested software
A self-starter who can demonstrate that they can succeed working in a team that deals with ambiguity every day

Nice to have experience:

Experience with PostGIS, or any geography-heavy applications
Experience with NoSQL datastores (Redis, MongoDB, ElasticSearch)
DevOps experience with Terraform/Salt/Ansible
High-throughput realtime data processing with pubsub/queues/streaming data
Has deployed applications using Kubernetes
Experience with GraphQL/Apollo
A DevOps mindset
Has contributed PRs to open source projects
